name: Kawa-Kawa
info: A Sinner who is adept at defending. Blocks 2 enemies at the same time and increases Magic Resistance by 5%.
criminalRecord:
A guide of a border town of WhiteSands, he was arrested on suspicion of trespassing and destroying the WhiteSands trade channel. According to the investigation, the subject had also helped many WhiteSands bandits and exhibited many strange behaviors. His presence had also seriously affected the management practices around DIS, obstructing the regular flow of Hypercubes.

--

Records show that since childhood, the subject lived a secluded life with his father who's also a cartographer. His ignorance of basic societal values can explain why he mistakenly took the supplies from the base station and aided the bandits. The subject is otherwise very knowledgeable in his professional area and is a very bright student.

After some basic education, the subject can now fully comprehend how society works and is unlikely to suffer the same accusations again in the future.
mutationAssessment:
+++* Ability Summary
Kawa-kawa's power can influence the beacon that he carries. When unfolded, it will form a small shelter that provides protection for those in it.

+++* Awakening Signs
While surveying alone, he encountered a sandstorm in the WhiteSands and awakened his power in the face of despair. In the end, he was able to make it through the crisis with his special powers and his remarkable survival skills.

+++* Corruption State
He has recently awakened with a low level of corruption. He has a clear mind and a strong will. There is some stubborn behavior unrelated to corruption. No serious negative effects were detected due to Mania for the time being.
interrogation1:
Kawa-kawa is held in the interrogation room for multiple violation records. He's not sure why he's being held there only that he has important work to do back in WhiteSands. The Chief tries their best to explain to them that they're being held at the MBCC for being a Sinner. And not only did Kawa-kawa violate official regulations, but that he's aided and abetted bandits. He doesn't understand this line of thinking believing that's he's only been helping, and believes that everyone in WhiteSands values life more than themselves getting quite angry about the idea he shouldn't help someone. After showing him footage of people he's helped mowing down helpless cruiser crew members he gets a horrifying shock. While Chief explains that they should be more perceptive from now on it's almost glossed over as Kawa-kawa hears that he might be let out to help with a cleansing operation. Later on, Nightingale expresses her distrust for the boy, but the Chief trusts him as a navigator more than as a possible bandit.

Though Nightingale doesn't trust him, you let the boy join the MBCC's WhiteSands operation. You trust the navigator in front of you more than data produced by so-called experts.
interrogation2:
The mission goes awry, with an accident stranding the crew in the desert. Kawa-kawa while angry that there's not enough provisions to last until rescue immediately jumps to action to get more. In his naivety he doesn't realize that the place he remembers helping the people from were from the same group of bandits they were pursuing. The Chief lets him learn that his kindness isn't deserved by everyone. And in a tactical move the bandits are overtaken with the use of beacons belonging to Kawa-kawa preventing any harm to either side.

Kawa-kawa uses his power to fight for the first time. His power is supposed to be gentle, and used to protect everyone. However, some people don't deserve his kindness.
interrogation3:
Hunkered down in the now taken fortress the Chief and crew are waiting out the sandstorm as Kawa-kawa returns with provisions. On this day they're to reset the beacons to better wait out the sandstorm. Kawa-kawa reminisces about how his father was looked down upon by his village and even himself. While he believed his father to be stupid he eventually realizes how important his father's and grandfather's work was to navigating the desert safely. He never did find his father, but he continues his forefather's work regardless in hopes of helping others like they did. The Chief reassures him that it's possible his father may follow his beacons back to him like how his father's beacons led him to safety.

Like his forefathers, Kawa-kawa has dedicated his all to WhiteSands. The beacons beaming a bright blue light across the desert are his future goals. They shall connect to the sky and merge with the stars.
arrestRec1: He was put on the watch list by the FAC for repeatedly helping the bandits in the WhiteSands. The MBCC encountered him in the WhiteSands while on a mission and took him into custody the moment he was discovered to be a Sinner.
arrestRec2: Having always lived a secluded life, the subject struggles to blend into human society due to the lack of common sense, and has a unique yet incorrect understanding of social intercourse. The subject will help anyone who asks for help without hesitation.
arrestRec3: Vigorous and resilient, the subject has both the abilities and the experience to survive in the wild. It's like a walk in the park that the subject can even spare some attention to help those who are in danger.
arrestRec4: Born in the borderland of The DisCity in a town near the WhiteSands, the subject lost his mother when he was little, and he rarely saw his father. The townsfolk laughed at him, calling him the son of a fool. When he turned eight, he received valuable research data from his father. Since then, he has carried on the legacy of his father and the father before him and taken up the mantle of drawing a map of the WhiteSands.
servingTerm1: His luggage weighs 20kg and is something he will not abandon under any circumstances. Inside are the necessities of survival in the wilderness and hundreds of surveying maps, which Kawa-kawa considers "life dependent".
servingTerm2: As a result of reading books left by his grandfather and father since childhood, Kawa-kawa is far more knowledgeable than his peers. This is especially true in wilderness survival, where he has reached the expert level with strong theoretical knowledge and extensive first-hand experience.
servingTerm3: He easily believes the lies of others and have been deceived many times by other Sinners to perform dangerous work on their behalf. However, Kawa-kawa has no complaints about this and is even happy to do it. He sees it as a necessity to reach her ideals.
servingTerm4: Kawa-kawa cherishes the surveying manuscripts of his father and grandfather very much. But he made an exception and presented a copy of a map to the Chief. He invited the Chief to survey with him so as not to disappoint his father's ideals.
emotionCheck1:
[Kawa-kawa is a little upset.]

**Kawa-kawa:** Chief, I‚Äôm missing a few beacons.

**Chief:** ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

* **Prompt:** Perhaps you lost them somewhere at the mission location?
 * **Kawa-kawa:** No, I only carry them with me if the mission has to do with WhiteSands.
 * **Kawa-kawa:** üòê

* **Prompt:** Perhaps you lost them in the Training Room?
 * **Kawa-kawa:** You're right! I haven't been looking there!
 * **Kawa-kawa:** üòò
emotionCheck2:
[Kawa-kawa looks at you with anticipation.]

**Kawa-kawa:** Chief! When will we return to the WhiteSands?

**Chief:** ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

* **Prompt:** It really has been awhile since we checked on the WhiteSands. We‚Äôll head out tomorrow.
 * **Kawa-kawa:** Okay! If there is a chance, we'll go to the WhiteSands and watch the meteor shower together!
 * **Kawa-kawa:** üòòüòò

* **Prompt:**Everything‚Äôs good in WhiteSands lately. I‚Äôll definitely let you know when something happens.
 * **Kawa-kawa:** Alright. When the time comes, I'll be your guide...
 * **Kawa-kawa:** üòò
supervision1:
++* ‚ö† A Tremor

//A tremor starts somewhere near the door to the office...//

**System Notifications:** A tremor starts somewhere near the door to the office... 

* **Prompt:** Earthquake?! 

**Kawa-kawa:** Sorry, Chief, it's me. I dropped my backpack. 

**Chief:** What on earth are in your backpack?
supervision2:
++* ‚ö† Desert Delicacies

//Kawa-Kawa suggests new dishes to the MBCC's cafeteria.//

**System Notifications:** Kawa-Kawa suggests new dishes to the MBCC's cafeteria: Barbecued WhiteSands lizard, Air-dried WhiteSands Scorpion, WhiteSands Snake Jerky, and Marinated WhiteSands Spiders

* **Prompt:** Reject

**System Notifications:** The cooks agree with you.
supervision3:
++* ‚ö† Water, A Precious Community

//You intend to throw away half a bottle of water.//

**System Notifications:** You buy a bottle of water from the vending machine. You drink half of it and intend to throw the other half away.

**Kawa-kawa:** Chief, water is a precious commodity. You‚Äôre gonna‚Ä¶ throw that away?

* **Prompt:** Drink it up!

**Kawa-kawa:** Good for you, Chief! Efficient as ever, even when it comes to drinking water!
supervision4:
++* ‚ö†‚ö† A Naive Person 

//Kawa-kawa returns from a mission, with most of his gear gone.//

**Kawa-kawa:** Good morning, Chief, I'm back! Mission accomplished! 

**System Notifications:** Kawa-kawa returns to the MBCC, carrying his backpack. He seems to be in a good mood. 

**Chief:** Your backpack looks a lot lighter. 

**System Notifications:** Glad that you notice this, he can hardly wait to tell you about his experiences. 

**Kawa-kawa:** Haha, Chief, everything's good. I gave some of my gear to those in need.

**Chief:** Like whom? 

**Kawa-kawa:** A young man. I met him when I just arrived in Syndicate. He asked me if I could lend him some money. Said he needed to finance his grandparents' education. 

**Kawa-kawa:** I didn't have too much money with me. So I gave him the most valuable piece. 

**Chief:** And...? 

**Kawa-kawa:** A young lady. I met her when I was in Eastside. She asked me to help with her luggage. 

**Kawa-kawa:** So I put my stuff to one side. When I was done helping her, my stuff was gone. Must have been the hyenas. Those rotten beasts! 

**Kawa-kawa:** I lost something, but I also helped some people. So it's kind of worth it. 

**Chief:** I'll ask someone to go with you next time you're going into town for a mission. 

**Kawa-kawa:** Fantastic! Who will it be? 

* **Prompt:** [[[Hella]]]
* **Prompt:** [[[EMP]]]
supervision5:
++* ‚ö†‚ö† Competitive Eating

//Kawa-kawa wins first place in an eating contest.//

**System Notifications:** An eating contest is being held in the recreation area. Kawa-kawa is one of the contestants.

**Crowd:** Come on! Come on!
Come on, [[[Hella]]]!
You can do this, [[[Wolverine]]]!
Go go go, [[[Horo]]]!

**System Notifications:** Just as every contestant is running out of steam, something incredible happens.

**System Notifications:** Kawa-kawa suddenly pulls out all the stops; he not only finishes his own food but also starts grabbing food from other contestants' plates and stuffing it into his mouth.

**System Notifications:** We've got a winner!

**System Notifications:** Unbelievable! The biggest dark horse in this eating contest! Kawa-kawa!

**System Notifications:** Let's hear Contestant Kawa-kawa's victory speech.

**Kawa-kawa:** Don't... waste... food... Burrrp!

**System Notifications:** Kawa-kawa passes out as soon as he finishes the sentence.

* **Prompt:** Help carry Kawa-kawa out

**Chief:** Mmmph! He's heavy!
baseVoicelines:
[Obtain the Sinner]
I can sleep here all the time, right? Wow! It's got so much space inside. Not even a breath of wind can get in! It's much better than camping. Great, I finally have a place to stay.

[Raise to Phase 1]
Thank you! This will allow me to finish the map quicker!

[Raise to Phase 3]
One day, I will place beacons in every corner of WhiteSands. I'm confident of it now!

[Level Start]
Don't worry. Fieldwork is my strong suit.

[Win Battles]
Great! Now a safety beacon can be placed here too!

[Lose Battles]
Hurry! This way! We can duck through.

[Ultimate Skill]
Hide beside it!

[Die in Battles]
I don't... feel well...

[Greeting]
Hello! I thought you got lost and was about to look for you.

[Conversation 1]
If you encounter a sandstorm, look for a beacon nearby... like this one in my hand. Hide next to it, then you should be able to survive it.

[Conversation 2]
Why do you keep catching those... they are called desert bandits, right? They hardly ever hit me with a gun. Sometimes they would ask me to be their guide and give me fresh water after getting them to places. I think they are nice people.

[Conversation 3]
Hehehe, I'm not as impressive as you said, at least not as good as Dad and Grandpa. I learned all my geography knowledge from the book grandpa wrote.

[Special Conversation 1]
Your food here is so delicious. Especially the broth‚ÄîI would never have thought putting large chunks of meat and water together would taste so much better than roasting scorpions and lizards!

[Special Conversation 2]
There are a few very strange places in WhiteSands with people looking stern and carrying guns everywhere. I get kicked out every time I go in for a break‚Äîbut it's so spacious inside. How mean.

[Special Conversation 3]
I always thought if I placed beacons all over WhiteSands, my dad would come back. But it's been seven years... I will finish his and Grandpa's plan, then I will go find him.

[Full Compliance]
The starry sky over WhiteSands is incredibly stunning, especially when there's a meteor shower... Let's go see it together when we have the chance. There's an awesome viewing spot that only I'd know.

[Idle]
//hums//  When Johnny Comes Marching Home

[Annoyed]
Do you want my hat? But this one is very worn-out. Let me make a new one for you.

[Special Attention]
You want me to stay here with you? Sure! By the way, when are we going back to WhiteSands? I have a lot of work to do there.

[Dispatch]
Oh, did someone get lost?

[Dispatch Complete]
No need to pay me. I don't need it. I'm glad I can help.

[Level Up]
Wind and sand can't stop me!
nightmareTalent: All allied units gain a 15% boost of Shield effects given.

exclusiveCrimebrand.name: Rising from the Wild Sands
exclusiveCrimebrand.description: After Kawa-Kawa performs [Protective Beacon], a shockwave will spread from the target grid, immediately restoring 15%/17.5%/20% of Max HP for all allies within a 3x3 square around the grid.

crimebrandSets.name: Tanky
crimebrandSets.note: Standard tanky build to increase block and defense.

crimebrandSets.name: Team heal
crimebrandSets.note: Can help increase healing done if needed.

shackles.title: First Step
shackles.description: At the start of the battle, Kawa-Kawa immediately places a [Protective Beacon] on his current grid.

shackles.title: Shelter
shackles.description: For every [Protection Beacon] on the battlefield, Kawa-Kawa gains a 3% received healing effect increase bonus, capped at 6 stacks.

shackles.title: Emotion Resonance
shackles.description: Ultimate Energy Consumption is reduced by 3 points.

skills.name: Defensive Counterattack
skills.description: Kawa-Kawa attacks with his cane, dealing (77% of Attack damage) Physical Damage each time.

skills.name: Protective Beacon
skills.description: Kawa-Kawa selects a grid and creates a [Protective Beacon] that lasts for the entire battle. Any ally with the [Protection Beacon] recovers 1% of Max HP per 2 seconds.

skills.name: Safe Route
skills.description: After Kawa-Kawa performs [Protective Beacon], all [Protective Beacon] are activated and recovers the allied Sinners with the Beacons 11% Max HP.

skills.name: Windproof Pulse
skills.description: Each [Protective Beacon] on the battlefield gives Kawa-Kawa 2% Magic Resistance bonus. This effect can stack up to 6 times.

compliance: Unlocke File: Supervision record , Magic Resistance +8, Health +79
Unlock Voice: special conversation 1, Magic Resist+ 8, Health + 79
Unlock File: Performance in Serving Term
Unlock Voice: Special Conversation 3, Unlock Requirements: Complete Kava Kava's Review
Unlock File: Performance in Serving Terms, Unlock Voice: Full Compliance Title: The navigator of the Sand Sea
supervision6:
++* ‚ö†‚ö†‚ö† Tales of the WhiteSands

//Kawa-kawa is reading a book titled Tales of the WhiteSands.//

**System Notifications:** Kawa-kawa is reading a book titled //Tales of the WhiteSands// when you come upon him.

**System Notifications:** He laughs as he reads.

**Kawa-kawa:** Hahaha, so hilarious, these stories.

**Kawa-kawa:** Chief, listen to this: there is this turtle in the Whitesands, it crawls at midday for one hour every day to boost its stamina.

**Kawa-kawa:** It can‚Äôt be that stupid! Crawling at midday‚Ä¶ it‚Äôd soon become turtle jerky.

**Kawa-kawa:** Here is another one: A clever traveler runs out of food, and he finds a sandworm nest and eats the sandworm eggs.

**Kawa-kawa:** Sandworm eggs are highly poisonous. He would die in a minute.

**System Notifications:** Kawa-kawa laughs so hard that tears come out. He may be reading a joke book, for all you know.

**Kawa-kawa:** Hahaha, this is the funniest book I‚Äôve ever read, so funny.

**Kawa-kawa:** Ooh, this story is about‚Ä¶ the Eternal Oasis.

**System Notifications:** His face takes on a sad expression.

* **Prompt:** What is it?

**Kawa-kawa:** I‚Äôve heard about the legend of the Eternal Oasis.

**Kawa-kawa:** Legend has it that there‚Äôs a route in the Whitesands that takes you to an oasis where the weather is always fine, and water and food are always abundant.

**Kawa-kawa:** It‚Äôs called the Eternal Oasis.

**Kawa-kawa:** When I was a kid, I often wondered if the reason my father didn‚Äôt come home was that he‚Äôd found the Eternal Oasis.

**Kawa-kawa:** It‚Äôs said that whoever enters the oasis will be so stunned by the heavenly landscape that they will never want to leave.

**Kawa-kawa:** Chief, does the Eternal Oasis really exist?

* **Prompt:** Yes.
 * **Kawa-kawa:** Do you really think so? I always thought it was a made-up story.
 * **Kawa-kawa:** But I've also heard that the safe route through the Whitesands isn't real.
 * **Kawa-kawa:** Maybe the oasis is real.
  * **Prompt:** Encourage him
 * **Kawa-kawa:** Mmm!
 * **System Notifications:** Kawa-kawa nods his head to you with enthusiasm.

* **Prompt:** No.
 * **Kawa-kawa:** That‚Äôs what I figured; you don‚Äôt think it is real either.
 * **Kawa-kawa:** I believed it was real as a kid. It might have been a way of comforting myself.
 * **Kawa-kawa:** I liked to think that my father way trapped in an oasis and was waiting for me to rescue him.
 * **Kawa-kawa:** Though the Eternal Oasis is not real, the safe route through the WhiteSands is. Its existence has been proven by my grandfather and father.
 * **Kawa-kawa:** My father, he must be waiting for me at the end of the route.
  * **Prompt:** Must be.
 * **Kawa-kawa:** Mmm!
 * **System Notifications:** Kawa-kawa nods his head to you with enthusiasm.

voicelines.Special Conversation 3 - KR: ÎÇú Ï§ÑÍ≥ß ÎÇ¥Í∞Ä ÌôîÏù¥Ìä∏ ÏÉåÎìúÏóê ÎπÑÏΩòÏùÑ Îã§ ÍΩÇÏïÑÎÜìÏúºÎ©¥ ÏïÑÎπ†Í∞Ä ÎÇ† Ï∞æÏúºÎü¨ Ïò¨ Ï§Ñ ÏïåÏïòÏñ¥. ÌïòÏßÄÎßå 7ÎÖÑÏù¥ ÏßÄÎÇ¨Ïñ¥‚Ä¶ ÎÇòÎäî ÏïÑÎπ†ÏôÄ Ìï†ÏïÑÎ≤ÑÏßÄÏùò Í≥ÑÌöçÏùÑ ÏôÑÏàòÌï† Í±∞Ïïº. Í∑∏ÎïåÍ∞Ä ÎêòÎ©¥, ÏïÑÎπ†Î•º Ï∞æÏúºÎü¨ Í∞à Í±∞Ïïº.
voicelines.Full Compliance - EN: The starry sky over WhiteSands is incredibly stunning, especially when there's a meteor shower... Let's go see it together when we have the chance. There's an awesome viewing spot that only I'd know.
voicelines.Full Compliance - KR: ÌôîÏù¥Ìä∏ ÏÉåÎìúÏùò Î≥ÑÌïòÎäòÏùÄ Ï†ïÎßê ÏïÑÎ¶ÑÎã§Ïõå, ÌäπÌûà Ïú†ÏÑ±Ïö∞Í∞Ä ÎÇ¥Î¶¥ Îïå‚Ä¶ ÎÇòÏ§ëÏóê Í∏∞ÌöåÍ∞Ä ÎêòÎ©¥ Í∞ôÏù¥ Î≥¥Îü¨ Í∞ÄÏûê. ÎÇ¥Í∞Ä Í∏∞Í∞ÄÎßâÌûå Íµ¨Í≤Ω ÏûêÎ¶¨Î•º ÏïåÍ≥† ÏûàÍ±∞Îì†. Í±∞Í∏¥ ÎÇòÎßå ÏïÑÎäî Í≥≥Ïù¥Ïïº.
voicelines.Annoyed - EN: Do you want my hat? But this one is very worn-out. Let me make a new one for you.
voicelines.Annoyed - KR: ÎÇ¥ Î™®ÏûêÍ∞Ä Í∞ñÍ≥† Ïã∂Ïñ¥? ÌïòÏßÄÎßå Ïù¥Í±¥ ÎÑàÎ¨¥ Ïò§Îûò Ïç®ÏÑú ÎÇ°ÏïòÏñ¥. ÎÇ¥Í∞Ä ÏÉàÎ°ú ÌïòÎÇò ÎßåÎì§Ïñ¥ Ï§ÑÍ≤å.
voicelines.Special Attention - EN: You want me to stay here with you? Sure! By the way, when are we going back to WhiteSands? I have a lot of work to do there.

voicelines.Dispatch Complete - EN: No need to pay me. I don't need it. I'm glad I can help.
